qas.question: What is currently being planed west of Strasbourg?
What would the use of a new carriageway do in Alsace?

answers.text: reduce the buildup of traffic in that area

qas.question: What is the name the German Highway  that would of been crossed with the French Truck road?

answers.text: Hœrdt to the north of Strasbourg, with Innenheim in the southwest

plausible_answers.text: building a new dual carriageway west of Strasbourg

qas.question: The dual carriageway would link what interchange to the left of the Rhine?
What is the name of the new carriageway?
What percentage of traffic used the Karlsruhe-Basel Autobahn?
How many vehicles crossed teh Karlsruhe-Basel Autobahn per day in 1950?

context: At present, plans are being considered for <b4_0>building a <a0_0>new dual carriageway<a0_0/> west of Strasbourg<b4_0/>, which would <a1_0>reduce the buildup of traffic in that area<a1_0/> by picking up north and southbound vehicles and getting rid of the buildup outside Strasbourg. The line plans to link up the interchange of <a3_0><b5_0>Hœrdt<b5_0/> to the north of Strasbourg, with Innenheim in the southwest<a3_0/>. The opening is envisaged at the end of 2011, with an average usage of <b8_0>41,000<b8_0/> vehicles a day. Estimates of the French Works Commissioner however, raised some doubts over the interest of such a project, since it would pick up only about <b7_0>10%<b7_0/> of the traffic of the A35 at Strasbourg. Paradoxically, this reversed the situation of the 1950s. At that time, the French trunk road left of the Rhine not been built, so that traffic would cross into Germany to use the <a2_0><b6_0>Karlsruhe-Basel Autobahn<b6_0/><a2_0/>.
